title: How to Build Your PlayStation 2 Game Collection for Cheap

steps.headline: Start researching the popular titles.
steps.description: Such as Devil May Cry series from 1 - 3, Silent Hill games, Resident Evil games, Final Fantasy games, Max Payne 1 and 2, Grand Theft Auto series, God of War I & 2, and any other games that is considered as a popular title. Those games are a great start to your collection.

steps.headline: Evaluate just how much you could afford to spend.
steps.description: You can't just walk into the store and expect to pay for it if you don't know how much you could afford to spend.

steps.headline: If you consider shopping at GameStop, get an Edge card.
steps.description: It's a type of discount card for GameStop, it'll give you 10% off of any used games.

steps.headline: Don't just shop at one store, be a smart shopper by shopping at more than one store.
Try to only get the games you know you will play.
steps.description: There is no point to have a game if you don't bother playing it at least once in a while.

steps.headline: Consider getting them as gifts from your family.
steps.description: Sometimes if your family is nice enough they might decide to get a game for you on your birthday or during the holidays.

steps.headline: Wait till a special offer or Christmastime/Boxing Day.
steps.description: During those kinds of days, there's sometimes a discount for games you wanted. So waiting could sometimes pay off.
